But Steve Ballmer hinted that there are even more new features to come to the Windows Phone software. This year we're investing a significant amount to continue popularizing the phone, Steve Ballmer said. all the players have healed and returned to the lineup. Rick Pitino is more concerned about the development of Gorgui Dieng and sophomore Rakeem Buckles than he is about Preston Knowles , a senior. Unless you practice, you can't get better, Rick Pitino said. " Gorgui Dieng needs to practice- he's not Allen Iverson ." he left the show. "I haven't seen a full episode," the former Idol judge told reporters on a conference call for his upcoming music competition series, The X Factor. I've seen three minutes of a recap. From what I've seen and from what I've heard, it all seems to be going well. What I was more concerned about[ was] the ratings falling off a cliff, and that the whole genre might be over. But people are still excited about these shows, whether Dancing With the Stars, which has gotten better over the years, America's Got Talent... I think they've done a good job. Asked if Paula Abdul could be a judge on his new show, which debuts next fall and has not yet announced a full judging panel, Simon Cowell demurred. "I'm a massive fan

Robert King , who produces the show with his wife Michelle, said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert King said. But Keith Urbahn , who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out. "This area is so fraught with legal ramifications," Keith Urbahn said. "

digs at Tom Brady , Jets coach Rex Ryan lauded Ben Roethlisberger , noting how hard it can be to tackle the 6-foot-5, 241-pound quarterback. "I would've made him a defensive end," Rex Ryan said. Ben Roethlisberger will beat you up. I've never seen a guy take the hits he can take and also make people miss the way he does and be as accurate on the run. After the Eagles' Michael Vick , Ben Roethlisberger might be the toughest quarterback to sack, said Jets defensive end Shaun Ellis . "He's very strong. He's very elusive in the pocket,"
